item.title: After Trump vs. Harris election, these bitcoin traders expect rally to $100,000

item.title: Nvidia closes at record as AI chipmaker's market cap tops $3.4 trillion
item.description: Nvidia shares closed at an all-time high on Monday as the chipmaker continues to ride a massive wave of demand for its artificial intelligence chips.

item.title: Microsoft artificial intelligence VP Bubeck to join OpenAI
item.description: Microsoft said that Bubeck plans to work with OpenAI on its goal of reaching artificial general intelligence, or AGI.

item.title: Google signs deal with nuclear company as data center power demand surges
item.description: Google is the latest tech company to turn to nuclear energy as power demand from data centers surges.

item.title: Never mind the election — look for solid outperforming stocks, this investor says
item.description: Kim Forrest provided her tips for investing during heightened geopolitical tensions.

item.title: This 401(k) lawsuit showcases the power of a 50-year-old law

item.description: Options market activity shows these stocks posting earnings this week could rise or fall the most.

item.title: Dow, S&P 500 score more record closes to kick off first full week of Q3 earnings

item.description: "I view the totality of the data as saying monetary policy should proceed with more caution on the pace of rate cuts than was needed at the September ...

item.title: AI chatbots need some healthy disagreement to work best together, tech exec says
item.description: AI assistants are “too agreeable” and can’t replicate the very human dynamic of a good-natured discussion, Babak Hodjat, chief technology officer of A...

item.title: GOP candidates spend big at McDonald’s and Chick-fil-A while Dems favor Panera
item.description: Republican campaigns spent more than $200,000 at Chick-fil-A during the current election cycle, according to the Washington Post.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock secures first record in 4 months as customers seem locked in
Fed Governor Waller sees need for 'more caution' ahead when lowering interest rates
item.description: Waller on Monday signaled that future interest rate cuts will be less aggressive than the big move in September.

item.title: Fed's Waller skeptical of more big rate cuts amid worries of resurgent inflation
